data.title: journeytocanberra
data.text:
Discover a hands-on interactive science museum like no other, where the application of science and technology is fun, interactive and relevant.

​

Overview

​This attractions idealistic location, making it close by to other major Canberra attractions and its one in a life time experience it offers, makes it the perfect attraction to include in your tour of Canberra. As their is loads to do at Questacon, we have allotted a two hour time period for you to fully experience this attraction.

​

Founding

Founded in 1988, to promote an awareness for science and technology. The centre is now under the direction of Professor Graham Durant who faithfully leads a team of in excess of 200 staff members. Each year, Questacon opens its doors to over 400 000 visitors, each and every one of these patrons, experiencing science and technology in a never before seen fashion.

Educational Values

​​​Questacon's core approach to education is straightforward: people learn by doing. This core theme is kept throughout all their exhibitions and shows. Education at Questacon is brought to you in a fun and engaging manner, allowing you to further explore the fields of science and technology. Each of the exhibitions will not only consolidate what you already know but add to what you know. Through its exhibits and shows Questacon models a brilliant constructivist learning approach. Learning is all fun and games at Questacon, literally! With its informal learning environment, Questacon allows their patrons to explore the possibilities for themselves, utilising their first hand experience. Questacon's exhibits ​and activities are designed to accommodate the diversity of the experience, knowledge and most importantly thoughts that their patrons bring, because not everyone thinks in the same manner. Rather then teaching the facts Questacon assists its patrons in developing a positive and knowledgable association with both science and technology.

Fun Factor

Questacon makes learning fun! Take a leap into the wild side of life and take the two storey vertical free fall drop. Watch a lightening bolt transpire, experience a simulated earthquake of five magnitude! Create a mini tsunami, play a game of four way cross air hockey or challenge a robot in a game of air hockey. In Questacons new permanent exhibition Soak Up the Science, launch a hydrogen rocket, or pump water to the ceiling, their is loads to do in this exhibitions sixteen exhibits. Explore Questacon's imagination factory with a test to determine if you are strong enough to lift your friends mass, or assemble the correct combination of gears to create the fastest toy animal. Here at Questacon you are sure to have all the fun in the world with this centres in excess of 200 seperatate exhibitions, learning has never been so fun.

Facilities

Food : Ensure you make a quick stop off at Questacon's Mega Bites cafe to collect your groups lunch, that 'Journey to Canberra Tours' has organised for you. This lunch is a sandwich pack, compromising of a sandwich, Fun sized chocolate bar, piece of fruit and small bottle of water (SEE PRICING AND MORE). This lunch can be enjoyed in the surrounding parklands adjacent to the centre. Excess snacks and food can also be purchased from this cafe.

Gift Shop: Located in the lobby, the Questacon gift shop, stocks all your scientific and technological needs, from goop to solar panels, they've got it all. Take home a souvenir to remember your visit, or purchase a book, a science toy, a science kit. As with the exhibits, all Questacon's gift shop's products are educational and fun. We have allotted 15 minutes at the end of your Questacon experience, for your students to browse or purchase these affordable gifts, toys and souvenirs.

Costings

​Due to the size of your large group, Questacon and 'Journey to Canberra Tours' have organised a discounted entry price of $13 per person, with the entry of 10 supervising adults free of charge for your group. Your 2 hour Questacon experience is available for the discounted total cost of $1,560.

Location​

​Adjacent to the renowned Lake Walter Burley Griffin and situated on King Edward Terrace, this attraction is situated in an idealistic location for our tour of Canberra.

Further Links

www.questacon.edu.au
